mb.graphics
Class GridBagFrame

java.lang.Object

                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      mb.graphics.GridBagFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.SwingConstants, javax.swing.WindowConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
TttFrame
public abstract class GridBagFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements javax.swing.SwingConstants, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener

GridBagFrame is an extension of JFrame that uses GridBagLayout to place components.

Author:
Mateusz Bysiek, mb@mbdev.pl, http://mbdev.pl/
See Also:
Serialized Form

x - position on the screen

width - width of the frame

getNewName

private java.lang.String getNewName(javax.swing.JComponent c)
Constructs a name for new component that is just to be added to the frame. Good for frames with contents that are static i.e. not deleted after creation.

Parameters:
c - reference to that component
Returns:
a default name: [simple name of class] + " " + [number of components already in the list] + " "
